intro: Aotus phylicoides, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many vines and climbing plants. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or forested areas. Aotus phylicoides is known for its rapid growth and is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
